description: These easy, cheesy English muffin pizzas can be topped and garnished with whatever you please, from pepperoni and olives to mushrooms and fresh basil.
headline: The Best English Muffin Pizza

HowtoTip.text: Make ahead: The pizzas can be assembled and refrigerated unbaked up to 1 day in advance, or frozen for up to 1 month. Freeze on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet until solid then transfer to an airtight container or large zip-top bag. Bake straight from the freezer (no need to thaw) at 375°F until the cheese is melted and the pizzas are heated through, about 15 minutes.Storage: Leftovers can be refrigerated in an airtight container for up to 4 days.

name: The Best English Muffin Pizza
recipeIngredient: 3/4 cup pizza or marinara sauce, divided
1 1/2 cups shredded low-moisture mozzarella cheese (about 6 ounces), divided
Toppings options: Mini pepperoni, sliced olives, sautéed mushrooms
Garnish options: Torn fresh basil leaves, grated Parmesan cheese, red pepper flakes

recipeInstructions.text: Arrange a rack 6 to 8 inches below the broiling element and heat the oven to 400oF. Line a rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper.
Split 4 English muffins in half with a fork. Place cut-side up on the prepared baking sheet. Toast in the oven until very lightly browned, about 5 minutes. Set aside and set the oven to broil.

Divide 3/4 cup pizza or marinara sauce between the English muffins (1 1/2 tablespoons on each half) and spread to the edges. Sprinkle with 1 1/2 cups shredded mozzarella cheese. Scatter with toppings if desired.
Broil until the cheese is melted and browned in spots, rotating the baking sheet as needed, 3 to 4 minutes. Garnish with torn fresh basil leaves, grated Parmesan, and/or red pepper flakes if desired.
